messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] He Read a Book!
messages.msgSnippet: ... == Good for him, and you Tia :) Todd Our HOME page http://rambleman.tripod.com/index.html
messages.messageBody:
At 08:53 PM 9/13/02 -0700, you wrote:

>Lars read his very first whole book.
==
Good for him, and you Tia :)

Todd

Our HOME page
http://rambleman.tripod.com/index.html

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] He Read a Book!
messages.msgSnippet: ... He s 14, almost 15.  He could read when he was 12, but I had forced the issue at that time, insisting on phonics work.  Big mistake.  I often wonder
messages.messageBody:
>How old is your son?
>Just curious, Jane (who is still waiting for her 10.5 year old to read a
>book)

He's 14, almost 15. He could read when he was 12, but I had forced the
issue at that time, insisting on phonics work. Big mistake. I often
wonder whether he would have taken off with it earlier if I'd left him alone.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: He Read a Book!
messages.msgSnippet: Congrats to your son Tia. His world just got bigger. :-) love, Valerie
messages.messageBody:
Congrats to your son Tia. His world just got bigger. :-)

love, Valerie

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] He Read a Book!
messages.msgSnippet: And congrats!!!!!! ... From: Tia Leschke [mailto:leschke@islandnet.com] Sent: Friday, September 13, 2002 10:53 PM To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
And congrats!!!!!!

-----Original Message-----
From: Tia Leschke [mailto:leschke@...]
Sent: Friday, September 13, 2002 10:53 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] He Read a Book!

Those of you who have watched me struggle with my son's non-reading and
then very slow reading, will understand how much the subject line means.
<g>
While we were on our holiday (which actually was the week from hell -
more
later) Lars read his very first whole book. It was a young adult
science
fiction type book. Last year he was only reading the captions and
sidebars
in his biking magazines, and this spring he had started to read the
articles and interviews. I'm not sure just why he started the book and
kept on with it, but you can bet I'm happy about it.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island
